txt.en: Spears, swords, shields, and armour can be collected from yards throughout Stoke.\n\nCaptain Grimmar asked you to collect spears, shields, swords, and armour for the garrison.
Deliver the arms and armour to the armoury stockpile
Grimmar is in the Mead Hall of Stoke.\n\nYou should return to Grimmar and tell him that you have done all he asked.
'Hark ye, Men of Stoke! The Wolves of Isengard snarl upon our doorstep and the Reeve has need of your able arms...!'
'And in the south, Théoden King calls for his Riders...!'
'I know that you are loutish and unskilled now, but soon you will be true fighting men....'
'I am in command here...and I am trying to give instruction....'
'Ah, you have done well, [placeholder]! Here come the louts now! I'll have a word or two for them, ere they join the garrison....'
There are places to post the conscription notices throughout Stoke.\n\nGrimmar wants you to post the conscription notices he gave you.
The armoury stockpile is outside the Mead Hall of Stoke.\n\nGrimmar told you to bring the arms and armour to the armoury stockpile.
'What do you mean loutish, Huthric! I will give you loutish....'
'Is that so? Huthric, Stoke is not so large that we do not know each other and well. We are all here and ready to fight...be done with it already.'
'My thanks to you, [placeholder]! I will speak with you again when Fríthild calls the council.'

'If you truly wish to help Stoke, then post these conscription notices and gather our supplies. We need swords, shields, armour, and spears a-plenty. We have had craftsmen throughout Stoke producing them for us with instructions to leave the finished products in their yards.\n\n'I need you to gather them and bring them to the armoury stockpile outside the Mead Hall. Once you are done with that, post the notices and meet my lieutenant, Huthric, outside.'
Huthric is outside the Mead Hall of Stoke.\n\nYou should speak with Huthric and let him know that you have done as Captain Grimmar has asked.
War is afoot, and the town of Stoke is preparing for the inevitable siege.
'Ah, nevermind him...Huthric thinks that he is important now that Grimmar has made him a lieutenant.'
'Next you know, he will be parading about Stoke like he is the Reeve herself....'
